places.name: Janaki Temple
places.description: A sacred Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Sita, located in Janakpur.
places.detail: Janaki Temple is an iconic religious site built in 1910 AD, featuring Mughal and Rajput architectural styles. It is believed to be the birthplace of Goddess Sita and a major pilgrimage site for Hindus.

details.subtitle: Mythological Significance
details.text: Associated with the Ramayana epic as the marriage place of Lord Rama and Sita

details.subtitle: Construction
details.text: Built by Queen Vrisha Bhanu of Tikamgarh, India

details.subtitle: Religious Tourism
details.text: Hosts thousands of pilgrims during Vivah Panchami and Ram Navami festivals

details.subtitle: Cultural Symbol
details.text: A center for Maithili culture and traditions

travelTips: Dress modestly as it is a religious site
Visit during festivals for a vibrant experience
Explore nearby ponds and other temples

places.name: Dhanushadham
places.description: A sacred site linked to the Ramayana, believed to be the remains of Lord Rama's broken bow.
places.detail: Located near Janakpur, Dhanushadham is a key pilgrimage site where devotees believe a fragment of Lord Rama's broken bow (from the Swayamvar of Sita) is preserved.

details.subtitle: Mythological Connection
details.text: Linked to the breaking of Shiva's bow in the Ramayana

details.subtitle: Archaeological Findings
details.text: Ancient relics and inscriptions found nearby

details.subtitle: Pilgrimage Site
details.text: Draws devotees from Nepal and India

details.subtitle: Tourism Development
details.text: Part of the Ramayana Circuit promoted by Nepal and India

places.name: Barahachhetra
places.description: A holy Hindu pilgrimage site at the confluence of the Koka and Koshi rivers.
places.detail: Barahachhetra is an ancient temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu's Varaha (boar) incarnation. It is one of the four major Chhetra (sacred sites) in Nepal.

details.subtitle: Religious Texts Mention
details.text: Cited in Puranas and Hindu scriptures

details.subtitle: Archaeological Importance
details.text: Nearby ruins suggest an ancient settlement

details.subtitle: Pilgrimage Destination
details.text: Major draw during Makar Sankranti and other festivals

details.subtitle: Cultural Heritage
details.text: Preserves traditional Hindu rituals and practices

travelTips: Visit during festivals for full experience

places.name: Gaurighat
places.description: A scenic riverbank area on the Koshi River with religious significance.
places.detail: Gaurighat is known for its peaceful environment, ashrams, and a temple dedicated to Goddess Gauri. It serves as a meditation and retreat center.

details.subtitle: Spiritual Legacy
details.text: Associated with Hindu saints and sadhus for centuries

details.subtitle: Flood History
details.text: Rebuilt after Koshi River floods in 2008

details.subtitle: Meditation Retreat
details.text: Popular for yoga and spiritual activities

details.subtitle: Eco-Tourism
details.text: Developing as a nature and culture destination

travelTips: Visit nearby Koshi Tappu Wildlife Reserve

places.name: Koshi Tappu Wildlife Reserve
places.description: A vital wetland ecosystem and bird sanctuary in eastern Nepal.
places.detail: Koshi Tappu is Nepal's first Ramsar site, famous for birdwatching and its population of wild water buffalo (Arna). The reserve covers 175 sq km along the Koshi River.

details.subtitle: Ecological Formation
details.text: Created by Koshi River's changing course over centuries

details.subtitle: Establishment
details.text: Declared wildlife reserve in 1976

details.subtitle: Biodiversity Hotspot
details.text: Home to 485 bird species and endangered species

details.subtitle: Research Importance
details.text: Key site for ornithological studies

places.name: Patanthar
places.description: A scenic hilltop offering panoramic views of the Terai plains and Himalayas.
places.detail: Patanthar is a developing viewpoint destination in Udayapur district, providing breathtaking sunrise/sunset views and cool climate.

details.subtitle: Indigenous Settlements
details.text: Home to ethnic communities for generations

details.subtitle: Strategic Location
details.text: Historically used as lookout point

details.subtitle: Tourism Potential
details.text: Emerging as a hill station for domestic tourists

details.subtitle: Agricultural Importance
details.text: Known for organic farming initiatives

places.name: Chinnamasta Temple
places.description: A unique Hindu temple dedicated to the self-decapitated goddess Chinnamasta.
places.detail: Located in Saptari district, this tantric temple attracts devotees seeking blessings and spiritual power. The goddess is depicted holding her own severed head.

details.subtitle: Tantric Tradition
details.text: Important Shakti Peetha in Tantric Hinduism

details.subtitle: Ancient Origins
details.text: Mentioned in medieval religious texts

details.subtitle: Religious Tourism
details.text: Draws tantric practitioners and curious visitors

details.subtitle: Cultural Heritage
details.text: Preserves unique Hindu traditions

places.name: Bardibas
places.description: A historic town and transportation hub with cultural significance.
places.detail: Bardibas serves as gateway to eastern Nepal with historical trade importance. It features traditional Maithili architecture and handicrafts.

details.subtitle: Trade History
details.text: Part of ancient trade routes between hills and plains

details.subtitle: British Era
details.text: Developed as administrative center during Rana regime

details.subtitle: Transport Hub
details.text: Key junction on East-West Highway

details.subtitle: Cultural Preservation
details.text: Center for Maithili language and arts

places.name: Siraha
places.description: Cultural town known for its historic temples and vibrant festivals.
places.detail: Siraha district headquarters features important religious sites and preserves Tharu and Maithili cultural traditions.

details.subtitle: Ancient Settlements
details.text: Archaeological finds suggest ancient habitation

details.subtitle: Medieval Period
details.text: Part of Mithila kingdom cultural sphere

details.subtitle: Agricultural Center
details.text: Major producer of rice and sugarcane

details.subtitle: Cultural Tourism
details.text: Known for traditional dance and music

places.name: Lahan
places.description: Commercial town famous for its agricultural products and cultural diversity.
places.detail: Lahan is known as the vegetable capital of Nepal, producing high-quality crops. It's a melting pot of Maithili, Tharu, and Newar cultures.

details.subtitle: Trade Center
details.text: Developed as market town in early 20th century

details.subtitle: Agricultural Development
details.text: Pioneered commercial farming in the region

details.subtitle: Economic Importance
details.text: Major supplier of vegetables to Kathmandu

details.subtitle: Cultural Exchange
details.text: Exemplifies Nepal's multicultural society
